item.title: Previse - HackTheBox machine
item.description:
• Rank: easy

These are the notes I took while attacking the machine. Note that it contains failed attempts that lead to dead ends but I edited them a bit to make the steps easier to follow.

item.title: Migration from previous blog
item.description: It’s been a while since I last wrote for my personal blog. Last year, while I was in 2nd year of Bachelor, I wrote more articles about Data Structures and Algorithms, and little things I found to be fancy about pentesting. After a year of self teaching and research, I’m now focusing more on reverse engineering, malware analysis and using data science for faster analysis. There are so many things that I want to know better, but I struggle because they are undocumented, and that’s why I decided to retake this.
item.content:
It’s been a while since I last wrote for my personal blog. Last year, while I was in 2nd year of Bachelor, I wrote more articles about Data Structures and Algorithms, and little things I found to be fancy about pentesting. After a year of self teaching and research, I’m now focusing more on reverse engineering, malware analysis and using data science for faster analysis. There are so many things that I want to know better, but I struggle because they are undocumented, and that’s why I decided to retake this. This blog is mainly for my own tracking but I hope it’s helpful for others and that I will update this more often!

The old blog is still stored at the master branch of RoundofThree/roundofthree.github.io.
